meanings.definition: To have an excessive amount of fear.
meanings.sent1: She overfears spiders and screams whenever she sees one.
meanings.sent2: I overfear failure, so I always try my best.
meanings.sent3: He overfears his own shadow, which makes everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her overfear of heights is like a heavy weight on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The overfear in her eyes was palpable as she entered the haunted house.

meanings.definition: To be overly afraid of something.
meanings.sent1: They overfear the dark and always keep a night light on.
meanings.sent2: Don't overfear change; sometimes it brings new opportunities.
meanings.sent3: She overfears clowns, which is quite amusing at the circus.
meanings.sent4: His overfear of public speaking is a barrier to his success.
meanings.sent5: The overfear in his voice was evident as he spoke about his phobia.
